intro: Rapuntium blandum, commonly known as the meadow fritillary, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Ranunculaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, showy flowers that typically range in color from white to pale yellow. The plant has palmate leaves that are usually divided into three to five lobes, and it thrives in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. It is native to parts of Europe and Asia and is often found in temperate climates. The plant is known for its short growing season and its role in supporting pollinators such as butterflies and bees.
